author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Separatists on Monday described the Lahore attack, which left 65 civilians dead, as “an act of terror.” Kashmir’s mainstream political parties too joined the condemnation of the incident.

A demonstration was organised by Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) in Srinagar where protesters raised slogans against those who carried out the attack on the Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park in Lahore.

“It was a barbaric attack and the perpetrators cannot be termed as human and part of civilised world. Islam and all other religions have clearly prohibited attacking innocents, children and women,” said JKLF chief Yasin Malik.

Several JKLF leaders pledged to “protest against the terror acts but asked the international community to differentiate between political struggles and terrorism.”

Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, who heads the All Parties Hurriyat Conference (APHC), said: “Targeting innocent people and children is barbaric.”

Incarcerated Democratic Freedom Party (DFP) chief Shabir Ahmad Shah, general secretary of the Hurriyat headed by Syed Ali Geelani, asked the Pakistan government “to evict terrorism.”

“The perpetrators can in no way be called humans and such acts are unacceptable,” said Mr. Shah.
title: Lahore attack an act of terror, say separatists
